title: How should I write an effective statement of purpose for an internship? - Quora

response.answer_text: As you're writing your SOP, keep the following in your mind. And cover all these points, you're sure to win.  Divide your SOP into three major parts. Part one being: Introduction about yourself, a brief para on what you've studied and your eligibility. Part two: You must describe your technical knowledge and skillfully weave your technical knowledge with writing skills to make sure that they get a feeling that you're well versed with the subject you've chosen. Part three: Totally about softskills and interpersonal skills. In this part, you have to describe about how you can help towards the contribution in diversity of the college. About how you will adapt to the system of that college. Browse the college website and add few highlights about the college in your SOP, that will give them a feeling that you are thoroughly informed about everything. Briefly praise the country and why you'd want to reside there and do the so called course.  NOTE: Write an SOP in such a manner that it should seem as if you're talking to the person who's gonna read that. But not in an out and out formal manner. Remember, its a personal statement, and it should seem like one. If you'd let me know your email id or whatsoever through a comment.. I'd email you one of the SOP's I've written for my client about a month ago.  I've also attached a link, and its the best piece of advice on SOP writing as far as I know.  http://www.uni.edu/~gotera/gradapp/stmtpurpose.htm  ……

Completing an internship can be vital for your future career as it makes you a potential candidate for the job and gives you an opportunity to experience what you’ll be doing in the future, so be sure you’ll be asked to write a statement of purpose for internship in which you have to present yourself as best as possible. The hardest part of writing an effective SoP is figuring out how and where to start from. Formatting your statement in a proper way grabs the reviewer’s attention and makes him want to keep reading it. Here are the basic steps to take when writing an internship SoP: Write an outline of what you want to sayStart with a personal life storyDescribe your skills and knowledge related to the applicationExplain how it will benefit the companyMention your life goals and how this job will affect themRefer back to your story in the closing part and summarize everything you’ve written Also, remember to: pay attention to all requirements;talk to people around you in order to find out how they see you;convince the reader why you should be accepted;ask someone to proofread your statement.

Most fellowship programs offering internship for medical students require to submit a personal statement or statement of purpose (sometimes it’s also called a goal statement). It’s a great way for your future employers to evaluate your skills, interests and to identify whether you’re motivated enough for the fellowship or not. Your SoP has to be written with excellent grammar, proper spelling and accuracy. In case you have hardships with your essay, you can always find professional SoP for job application help.  Here are some useful tips on how to write your internship SoP properly in order to make a long-lasting impression on your potential employer: it should be concise, clear and easy-to-read: present a summary of your academic and professional backgrounds;don’t tell your life story, rather demonstrate relevant educational, research and career accomplishments;how you can contribute to their community and the field you’ve chosen;don’t forget to include your future goals and research experience;tell why you should be accepted for the offered position;stick to the right length of your statement;don’t write long sentences;avoid using technical jargon and remove all of the grammatical/spelling errors.

Show what you have done so far and how this has been limited by a lack of practical experience. Show how the internship will give you the right kind of practical experience to bring to life your theoretical understanding of certain concepts. Show what you have studied in school/university and how this connects with the internship role. Explain your hopes and ambitions and how this internship will help you to achieve them.
